conclusion: Reconsidered the meaning of 'definite quality' and assumed fixed mass of gas.
Re-evaluated using Gay-Lussac's law and found T2 = 400 K.
Identified inconsistency between combined gas law and Gay-Lussac's law results.
Re-examined first approach and confirmed T2 = 800 K using combined gas law.
Re-applied Gay-Lussac's law and found T2 = 800 K.
